Description: Rim sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; large lotus flower in added white outline with added red centre above zigzag pattern between lines; top of rim glazed; exterior: frieze of short diagonals between brown lines above painted decoration consisting of lion (part of mane and shoulder remaining) to left.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Lions on Chalice Style vases are usually depicted facing right.
